headline: Airborne Toxins May Have Shaped Our Evolution
abstract: It’s not just a modern problem. Airborne toxins are so pernicious that they may have shaped our DNA over millions of years.
lead_paragraph: The threat of air pollution grabs our attention when we see it — for example, the tendrils of smoke of Australian brush fires, now visible from space, or the poisonous soup of smog that descends on cities like New Delhi in the winter.
